page.title: 07FARM CROPS IN GERRICK AREA
page.content:
There are 8 farms with a total of 1,000 acres of cultivated land and 3,000 acres of moorland - Grades 4 & 5 (Min. of Agric.). Subsoil is clay.
Mainly grass for silage and hay but some barley and wheat. One area of oil-seed rape sown to crop in 1986. Small amounts of potatoes and turnips for home use.
GRASS. Rye-grass is grown for silage. The permanent pasture has annual meadowgrass and perennial rye-grass. 1 - 3 crops of silage per year.
CEREALS. More winter than spring barley grown. Winter wheat is grown.
